intro: Stachytarpheta martiana, commonly known as the purpletop verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers that bloom throughout the year. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The plant is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts used in traditional herbal remedies.
